kuusisto.tinysound.internal

Interface MusicReference


  • public interface MusicReference
    The MusicReference interface is the Mixer's interface to the audio data of a Music object. MusicReference is an internal interface of the TinySound system and should be of no real concern to the average user of TinySound.
    Author:
    Finn Kuusisto

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Get the number of bytes remaining for each channel until the end of this Music.

      • getPlaying

        boolean getPlaying()
        Get the playing setting of this MusicReference.
        Returns:
        true if this MusicReference is set to play

        boolean getLoop()
        Get the loop setting of this MusicReference.
        Returns:
        true if this MusicReference is set to loop

        Get the pan of this MusicReference.

      • setPlaying

        void setPlaying(boolean playing)
        Set whether this MusicReference is playing.
        Parameters:
        playing - whether this MusicReference is playing

      • setLoop

        void setLoop(boolean loop)
        Set whether this MusicReference will loop.
        Parameters:
        loop - whether this MusicReference will loop

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(long position)
        Set the byte index of this MusicReference.
        Parameters:
        position - the byte index to set

      • setLoopPosition

        void setLoopPosition(long loopPosition)
        Set the loop-position byte index of this MusicReference.
        Parameters:
        loopPosition - the loop-position byte index to set

      • setVolume

        void setVolume(double volume)
        Set the volume of this MusicReference.
        Parameters:
        volume - the desired volume of this MusicReference

      • setPan

        void setPan(double pan)
        Set the pan of this MusicReference. Must be between -1.0 (full pan left) and 1.0 (full pan right).
        Parameters:
        pan - the desired pan of this MusicReference

      • bytesAvailable

        long bytesAvailable()
        Get the number of bytes remaining for each channel until the end of this Music.
        Returns:
        number of bytes remaining for each channel

      • done

        boolean done()
        Determine if there are no bytes remaining and play has stopped.
        Returns:
        true if there are no bytes remaining and the reference is no longer playing

      • skipBytes

        void skipBytes(long num)
        Skip a specified number of bytes of the audio data.
        Parameters:
        num - number of bytes to skip

      • nextTwoBytes

        void nextTwoBytes(int[] data,
                boolean bigEndian)
        Get the next two bytes from the music data in the specified endianness.
        Parameters:
        data - length-2 array to write in next two bytes from each channel
        bigEndian - true if the bytes should be read big-endian

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Does any cleanup necessary to dispose of resources in use by this MusicReference.
